stem: A lesion of the tibial nerve at the ankle most likely causes sensory loss where?

choices.C: Dorsum of the foot except first web space
choices.E: Lateral margin of the foot only

rationale_correct: Tibial nerve divides into medial and lateral plantar nerves supplying plantar foot sensation.

rationale_distractors.E: Sural nerve supplies the lateral foot margin.

evidence.citation: Heck C. Lower Limb Overview Handout â€” Cutaneous nerves distribution. Jun 16, 2025.
